item.title: APU Drive Generator Systems (Generator, AGCU, APB) – (APB's) Remains Open

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided associated Auxiliary Power Breaker(s) (APBs) remains open.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
When dispatching with APU Gen 1 inop turn #4 DEMAND PUMP to AUTO for pushback, #4 AUX inop due to Gnd Handling bus not powered.
If EEC CLNG SUP FAN status message is displayed, it can be cleared by rotating the EQUIP COOLING switch to OVRD, then back to NORM.

placard.para: Placard APU GEN Switch "INOP" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.title: APU DRIVE GENERATOR SYSTEMS (GENERATOR, AGCU, APB)
maintenance.para: Determine the APU Drive Generator System failure mode and accomplish the following steps as applicable:

numlitem.para: APU Drive Generator Bearing Failure:
Check the EICAS for status message APU GEN BEARING which indicates an APU generator bearing failure.
If a bearing failure has occurred, deactivate the associated generator as follows:
Verify BATTERY switch, located on P5 overhead panel, is set to ON.
Verify the associated APU generator FIELD OFF light is illuminated on the P461 panel.

note.para: If the FIELD OFF light is extinguished, momentarily toggle and release the associated APU generator field switch on the P461 panel.

numlitem.para: Place INOP placard on appropriate APU GEN switch (P5 panel).
Limit operation of the APU to ground use only (do not use during takeoff).
Do not operate the APU in excess of 15 hours total cumulative time following the initial bearing failure. Refer to item 49-11-1 to deactivate the APU if necessary.

note.para: The generator will be operating in a no-load condition when the APU is operating. Operation of APU for more than 15 hours total cumulative time following the initial generator bearing failure may result in severe damage to the APU generator and APU.

numlitem.para: APU Drive Generator Electrical Failure, Auxiliary Generator Control Unit (AGCU) Failure:
Verify EICAS status message APU GEN BEARING is not displayed.
If status message is present, refer to (M) step 1 “APU Drive Generator Bearing Failure.”
If the messages are not present, deactivate the generator(s) as follows:
Verify BATTERY switch, located on P5 overhead panel, is set to ON.
Verify the associated APU generator FIELD OFF light is illuminated on the P461 panel.

note.para: If the FIELD OFF light is extinguished, momentarily toggle and release the associated APU generator field switch on the P461 panel.

numlitem.para: Place INOP placard on appropriate APU GEN switch (P5 panel).

The generator will be operating in a no-load condition when the APU is operating. In this configuration, the potential for a generator bearing failure still exists. If the APU is operated, verify EICAS status message APU GEN BEARING is not displayed before each departure.
If status message is present, refer to step 1, “APU Driven Generator Bearing Failure.”
Auxiliary Power Breaker (APB) Failure:
Apply electrical power through external power receptacle No. 1 or apply power from engine-driven generator No.1 and/or No. 2.

note.para: If electrical power (from either an external power source or from engine-driven generator power) cannot be connected to the aircraft, this is an indication auxiliary power breaker No. 1 is failed closed.

numlitem.para: Verify all BUS TIE switches, located on P5 overhead panel, are set to AUTO.
Verify that the ISLN lights, located on P5 overhead panel, are extinguished.

note.para: If any ISLN lights are illuminated when engine generator power is applied, this is an indication auxiliary power breaker (No. 1 and No. 2) is failed closed.

numlitem.para: Verify split system breaker OPEN light, located on P461 pilots’ overhead maintenance panel is extinguished.

note.para: If split system breaker light is illuminated, toggle SPLIT SYSTEM BREAKER switch to close breaker. If split system breaker OPEN light remains illuminated, this is an indication auxiliary power breaker No. 2 is failed closed.
